page.title: 08Cliffe House,Shepley.
page.content: Cliffe House is a large stone detached house in ten acres of land and built at the end of the last century. Since 1948 it has been used as an outdoor centre for children, first of all from the Dewsbury area and then from the Kirklees District. Each year up to fifty five schools use the Centre residentially while there are fifty day visits. On average, 3,000 children and staff visit the centre each year for Environmental Education. Whilst at the Centre the children study farming, villages, woodlands, hedgerows, ponds and other topics connected with the environment, under the specialist eye of the warden Mr. Swindon. In the grounds there is a wood, two ponds, a herb garden and a playing field. By coincidence some of the stained glass windows depict nature scenes, mostly of birdlife.
